question: Maria had always loved to paint. As a child, she would spend hours creating colorful images of people and nature. Even though she became a teacher, she continued painting on weekends. What can be inferred about Maria?
The town was quiet after the storm, but signs of destruction were everywhere. Trees were uprooted, windows shattered, and power lines were down. What does this passage describe?
John had studied all night and skipped breakfast to get to school early. When the test began, he could hardly keep his eyes open. What is the most likely outcome?
choices: He will do well on the test.
He may fall asleep during the test.
correctAnswer: He may fall asleep during the test.

question: During the dry season, many farmers struggle as their crops fail to grow. This affects their income and food supply. What is the main idea of this passage?
choices: The dry season causes hardship for farmers.
Farmers don't work during dry seasons.
correctAnswer: The dry season causes hardship for farmers.

question: Anna donated her old books to the school library. She believed others could benefit from them just as she did. What does this say about Anna?
choices: She wanted to empty her shelves.

question: Despite being tired, Carlos continued working late into the night. He had a deadline to meet. What drives Carlos to keep working?
choices: He has nothing else to do.

question: Liza watched the news every evening to stay informed about current events. Why does Liza watch the news?
choices: She wants to be a journalist.

question: The students cheered when the principal announced a holiday next Friday. What is the mood of the students?
Peter watered his plants every day, but they still wilted. Later, he discovered the soil lacked nutrients. What is the cause of the wilting?
The train was delayed due to heavy rains and flooding on the tracks. Which of the following is true?
Despite several attempts, Jenny could not open the jar. She asked her brother for help. What does this show about Jenny?
The restaurant was famous for its delicious seafood dishes. People from nearby towns came to eat there. What made the restaurant popular?
Carlos rushed out of the house when he realized he had left his phone in the taxi. What is most likely his emotion?
Rain poured for hours, flooding the streets. Many residents stayed indoors for safety. What is the best title for this passage?
Although the instructions were clear, Mark skipped some steps and the shelf collapsed. What caused the failure?
Leah’s eyes widened in shock when she saw her test score. It was higher than she expected. What does this indicate?
choices: She was surprised by her high score.
correctAnswer: She was surprised by her high score.

question: Tina and her family went to the beach every summer. It was a tradition they looked forward to. What does this passage suggest?
choices: They are bored of the tradition.

question: Ben always checks the weather forecast before going on a hike. Why does he do this?
The children whispered while the baby slept. What were they trying to do?
As soon as the bell rang, the students packed up their things and rushed out of the classroom. What time was it likely?
